name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the Jazz Age that tells the story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and childhood innocence, centered around a young girl named Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother, where individualism and independent thought are persecuted.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel that explores the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who leaves his prep school in Pennsylvania and goes underground in New York City for three days.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prelude to the Lord of the Rings series, following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins as he helps dwarves reclaim their homeland from a dragon.

name: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The saga of Captain Ahab and his relentless pursuit of Moby Dick, the great white whale.

name: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping narrative that intertwines the lives of several families against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: The epic journey of Odysseus as he attempts to return home from the Trojan War, facing numerous trials and tribulations along the way.

name: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A coming-of-age story that follows the experiences of Jane Eyre as she becomes governess at Thornfield Hall and falls in love with Mr. Rochester.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic society characterized by technological advancements and an absence of individuality.

name: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors, focusing on the doomed relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

name: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem that describes Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, guided by the Roman poet Virgil.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that explores themes of faith, doubt, and reason through the lives of the Karamazov brothers.

name: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama that follows the moral dilemmas of Raskolnikov, a former student who plans and executes a murder.

name: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of Pip, a young orphan who comes into a mysterious fortune and navigates the challenges of wealth and society.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: The plight of the Joad family as they migrate westward during the Dust Bowl, seeking a better life in California.

name: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the journey of Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship as they attempt to destroy the One Ring.

name: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
description: A modernist novel that parallels the events of Homer's Odyssey in the lives of the characters in Dublin over a single day.

name: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic story of love, infidelity, and societal pressures, centered around the passionate affair between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.

name: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: The story of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel that explores themes of aestheticism, moral duplicity, and the nature of beauty through the life of Dorian Gray.

name: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A Gothic horror novel that introduces the character of Count Dracula and chronicles his attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

name: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A novel that explores the themes of existentialism and absurdism through the life of its protagonist, Meursault.

name: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical book that follows a young shepherd named Santiago in his journey to the pyramids of Egypt, after having a recurring dream of finding a treasure there.

name: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The story of a nobleman who reads so many chivalric romances that he decides to become a knight-errant and set off on a series of adventures.

name: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A story set after the American Civil War, revolving around the haunting legacy of slavery as experienced by Sethe and her family.

name: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about a group of expatriates in Europe during the 1920s, exploring themes of love, loss, and the meaning of life.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, depicting the plight of the French peasantry and the brutality of the aristocracy.

name: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A sweeping narrative that explores the lives of several characters, including the ex-convict Jean Valjean, in post-revolutionary France.

name: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel set during World War II, focusing on the absurdity of war and the bureaucratic constraints on soldiers.

name: The Call of the Wild
author: Jack London
description: A novel that tells the story of a domesticated dog named Buck who reverts to a wild state in the wilderness of Alaska.

name: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
description: A novel that addresses many of the social and intellectual issues faced by African Americans in the early twentieth century.

name: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A bleak story of a father and son's journey across a post-apocalyptic landscape.

name: Heart of Darkness
author: Joseph Conrad
description: A novella that explores the depths of human corruption and the darkness within the human soul.

name: Gulliver's Travels
author: Jonathan Swift
description: A satirical narrative that follows Lemuel Gulliver's travels to various fantastical lands.

name: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A story about the life of an unfulfilled provincial housewife who attempts to escape her banal existence through love affairs and material excess.

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A tale of an innocent man wrongfully imprisoned who escapes to enact a carefully planned revenge.

name: Lolita
author: Vladimir Nabokov
description: A controversial novel that explores complex themes of obsession, manipulation, and the nature of love.

name: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novella that tells the story of Gregor Samsa, a man who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a gigantic insect.

name: A Clockwork Orange
author: Anthony Burgess
description: A dystopian novel set in a near-future society that explores themes of free will, violence, and the impact of state control.
